result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Lee Leverenz

records.addlTxt: 9:00 AM Defendant Robert Lee Leverenz appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Robert Lee Leverenz.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Parties argue bond. Court modifies bond to $250 Cash with same conditions: Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Absolute sobriety. Not to possess any paraphernalia.
Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Absolute sobriety. Not to possess any paraphernalia.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:20 PM Defendant Robert Lee Leverenz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing set by court and by Zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:29 PM  Defendant Robert Lee Leverenz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Robert Lee Leverenz.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. $500.00 cash bond set with conditions.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Absolute sobriety. Not to possess any paraphernalia.  Adjourned initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 3:00 PM.
